explains: adj. 白种人的；高加索的

sentences.en: Ann Hamilton was a Caucasian from New England.
sentences.cn: 安·汉密尔顿是来自新英格兰的白人。

sentences.en: It is interesting to note that some studies show Caucasian American children have earlier childhood memories than Korean children do.
sentences.cn: 有趣的是，一些研究显示，白种美国儿童对童年的记忆比韩国儿童早。

sentences.en: A large Caucasian inmate steps forward.
sentences.cn: 一个强壮的白人向前迈了一步。
